examples: Her grandmother's garden was full of stone fruit trees.
I take full responsibility for my actions.
Many schools don’t take full advantage of the Internet.
See full dictionary entry for heart.
The school took the full force of the explosion.
words.defineEn: having no space left
words.defineVi: không còn chỗ trống

examples: The house has sat empty for two years.
Our waiter cleared the empty plates from the table.
I got an empty gift box.
He emptied the full trash can into the larger dumpster outside.
I placed my bag on the empty chair next to me.
words.defineEn: with no one or nothing inside
words.defineVi: không có ai hoặc không có gì bên trong

examples: Make the necessary preparations.
Standing on the shoulders of giants is a necessary part of creativity
Experts have urged ministers to take the necessary steps to resolve the issue.
If we make the necessary changes now, it will save us money in the long run.
Breakfast plays an important role as it provides the body with the necessary energy and nutrients to start the day.
words.defineEn: needed to be done for a particular reason or purpose
words.defineVi: cần phải được thực hiện cho một lý do hoặc mục đích cụ thể

examples: Just because you're a skilled driver doesn't mean you should take unnecessary risks on the road.
She learned to look for deals and discounts and to avoid unnecessary purchases.
We've restructured the organization to help eliminate unnecessary costs, but we're still not out of the woods.
This allowance is now made unnecessary with EMG's measurement technology.
This makes unnecessary the question of which Hebrew or Aramaic phrases stand behind the Greek.
words.defineEn: not needed at all or more that necessary
words.defineVi: hoàn toàn không cần thiết hoặc nhiều hơn mức cần thiết

examples: The poem uses simple language.
He prepared a simple sandwich with sliced luncheon meat, lettuce, and mayo for his quick lunch.
He prepared a simple salad with iceberg lettuce.
Simple childhood memories have a way of clearing the cobwebs away.
The girl's simple words had been ringing the death-knell of his expectations.
words.defineEn: not involving difficulty in doing or understanding
words.defineVi: không liên quan đến khó khăn trong việc làm hoặc hiểu

examples: This disaster comes hard on the heels of last week’s train crash.
The kids always work hard at school.
For Walter, disaster followed hard on the heels of his initial success.
Life on the road can be very hard.
She worked hard toward her degree.
words.defineEn: needing a lot of skill or effort to do
words.defineVi: cần rất nhiều kỹ năng hoặc nỗ lực để làm

examples: He received the maximum sentence allowed by law.
She prefers to wear loose-fitting pants for maximum comfort.
With the judge handing down the maximum possible sentence, this monster will be paying the fiddler for the rest of his life.
But your velocity is maximum.
The maximum displacement happens right here in the middle where the player's hand pushes on the stick.
words.defineEn: being the most or the greatest that is possible
words.defineVi: là nhiều nhất hoặc lớn nhất có thể

examples: The investment manager targeted high rollers, demanding a minimum investment of $100,000.
The minimum bid was $10,000.
When is your minimum acceleration?
All drafted rookies require a minimum of four years on the team.
My wife puts in, minimum of 60 hours a week and sometimes 80.
words.defineEn: being the least or the smallest amount possible
words.defineVi: là số tiền ít nhất hoặc nhỏ nhất có thể

examples: It was too near for comfort.
The big fellow keeps a fish shop near the post office.
Some of his jokes are a bit near the knuckle.
I hear the sound of seagulls near the sea.
My grandmother stands near the entrance to greet guests.
words.defineEn: not far from a place, time, condition, or situation
words.defineVi: không xa một địa điểm, thời gian, điều kiện, hoặc tình hình

examples: My mother throws that far away.
I've saved almost £100 so far.
The kangaroo can jump very far with its powerful hind legs.
The music was far too loud for my liking.
They went farther north into the mountains.
words.defineEn: being in a place or time that is not close
words.defineVi: ở một nơi hoặc thời gian không gần gũi

examples: Fireworks displays are common in many countries during the month of July.
Some common types of cooking oils include canola oil, vegetable oil, and sunflower oil.
They shared a common interest in botany.
In my experience, common fame is seldom to blame.
In Spanish culture, it is common to greet others with a kiss on each cheek.
words.defineEn: found or happening often
words.defineVi: tìm thấy hoặc xảy ra thường xuyên

examples: It's not uncommon for people to try to avoid paying their debts or to forget about them altogether.
Phobias aren’t uncommon, either.
That wasn't uncommon.
It was not uncommon -
So, androgenetic alopecia is actually not an uncommon trait.
words.defineEn: not found often
words.defineVi: không được tìm thấy thường xuyên

examples: That extension is busy right now.
Throughout the evening, the waiter handled the busy restaurant.
The train station is busy during rush hour.
The train station platform was busy with people waiting for their trains.
Tuesdays usually are my busiest days at work.
words.defineEn: having so many things to do in a way that leaves not much free time
words.defineVi: có quá nhiều việc phải làm theo cách không để lại nhiều thời gian rảnh

examples: Everything was free
The museum has free admission on Fridays.
Nothing in life is free, no penny, no paternoster.
The press as always gave him a free pass as with so many other issues.
The country is holding its first free elections for 20 years.
words.defineEn: having no particular plans; not busy
words.defineVi: không có kế hoạch cụ thể; không bận rộn

examples: He's just too lazy to come.
The lazy employee's work was not worth a brass farthing, and he was eventually fired for his lack of effort.
He can be lazy about doing his work, but when he gets the bit between his teeth there's no stopping him.
I enjoy reading a book or watching a movie during the lazy afternoon hours.
She calls him lazy and useless, but it's water off a duck's back to him
words.defineEn: not liking physical activity or unwilling to work
words.defineVi: không thích hoạt động thể chất hoặc không muốn làm việc

examples: The hardworking employee received a promotion for their exceptional performance.
He chose a loyal and hardworking employee from an ordinary background over one with an impressive resume but a questionable work ethic.
My husband is a hardworking and supportive partner who always puts family first.
Foreign companies and workers are not as hardworking as the Chinese.
These animals are super cool, and super hardworking, too!
words.defineEn: (of a person) working with a lot of effort, energy, and commitment
words.defineVi: (của một người) làm việc với rất nhiều nỗ lực, năng lượng và cam kết

examples: We should fill the bathtub with warm water for a relaxing bath.
My sister used to take a relaxing bath or shower before going to bed at night.
Costa Rica sounds like a great place for a relaxing vacation.
She sprinkled dried alkanet petals in her bathwater, turning it into a relaxing and visually appealing soak.
That was just so relaxing for me.
words.defineEn: helping our body or mind rest
words.defineVi: giúp cơ thể hoặc tâm trí của chúng tôi nghỉ ngơi

examples: She did well to keep her head in such a stressful situation.
Work was really stressful.
Things get stressful sometimes.
So, the holidays are stressful for anyone.
Maybe things are really stressful for them.
words.defineEn: causing a lot of worries, and putting pressure on someone's mind
words.defineVi: gây ra rất nhiều lo lắng, và gây áp lực lên tâm trí của ai đó

examples: She's as dumb as an oyster.
Whereat he smiled, but remained dumb as an oyster.
We would have gotten away with our plan if your dumb cousin hadn't started shooting off his mouth all over town.
I was struck dumb by the news.
After watching him play chess, I can safely say he's as dumb as a coal bucket when it comes to strategy games.
words.defineEn: stupid; slow to learn
words.defineVi: ngốc nghếch; học chậm

examples: Their daughter is as clever as they come.
This guy is either very clever or he's not playing with a full deck.
The clever student caught the teacher napping and managed to sneak out of class unnoticed.
In negotiations, a clever hawk hides its claws, which is why it's important to be strategic and hold back some of your bargaining chips until the right moment.
The film doesn't reinvent the wheel for action films, but it adds enough clever twists on the genre to still feel fresh and new.
words.defineEn: able to think quickly and find solutions to problems
words.defineVi: có thể suy nghĩ nhanh chóng và tìm giải pháp cho các vấn đề

examples: Are you feeling comfortable?
He always wears comfortable clothes when he goes for a run.
He likes the comfortable seats and big screen at the movie theater.
The room had a comfortable bed where she could rest.
The rug in front of the fireplace provides a comfortable spot to sit.
words.defineEn: (of clothes or furniture) making us feel physically relaxed
words.defineVi: (về quần áo hoặc đồ nội thất) khiến chúng ta cảm thấy thoải mái về thể chất

examples: As Jessica watched her son's new girlfriend interact with their family, she couldn't help but feel a bit uncomfortable, considering that the girl appeared to be old enough to be his mother.
After walking all day in uncomfortable shoes, Jane exclaimed, "My dogs are barking!"
Eating a big meal right before bed doesn't sit right with me - I always end up feeling bloated and uncomfortable.
Real eyes realise, and it's time for us to start confronting the uncomfortable truths about our society.
That chair looks super uncomfortable.
words.defineEn: (of clothes, furniture, etc.) unpleasant to use or wear; making someone physically uneasy
words.defineVi: (về quần áo, đồ nội thất, v.v.) khó sử dụng hoặc mặc; làm cho ai đó khó chịu về thể chất

examples: My father is very direct and pulls no punches.
The video was produced and directed by filmmaker Neil Campbell.
an actress who has turned her hand to directing
Just because a head coach might not have direct involvement in rules violations, that doesn't take him off the hook.
He began as an actor, before starting to direct films.
words.defineEn: going from one place to another in a straight line without stopping or changing direction
words.defineVi: đi từ nơi này đến nơi khác theo một đường thẳng mà không dừng lại hoặc thay đổi hướng

examples: In a world where miscommunication can lead to misunderstandings and conflicts, it's important to be straightforward and avoid relying on subtle or indirect cues - as they say, a nod is as good as a wink to a blind horse.
Chuck E. Cheese's indirect challengers come from every corner of the market.
Indirect talks between the United States and Iran resume Wednesday in Vienna.
So what's an indirect flight mechanism?
This indirect coordination strategy is called stigmergy.
words.defineEn: not going in a straight line or the shortest way
words.defineVi: không đi theo đường thẳng hoặc con đường ngắn nhất

examples: The brunch special featured a beefburger with a sunny-side-up egg, crispy bacon, and a dollop of hollandaise sauce.
That letter should go by special delivery.
They celebrated the special occasion with a beautifully molded aspic.
The chef's special included a tender beef fillet served on a bed of creamy garlic mash.
The bakery showcased a special maple sugar cake as the highlight of their seasonal menu.
words.defineEn: different from, greater, or better than what is normal
words.defineVi: khác với, lớn hơn hoặc tốt hơn những gì bình thường

examples: He preferred sweet potatoes over ordinary potatoes due to their natural sweetness.
He chose a loyal and hardworking employee from an ordinary background over one with an impressive resume but a questionable work ethic.
I roasted a mix of sweet potatoes and ordinary potatoes for a colorful and flavorful side dish.
While ordinary onions have a strong pungent flavor, Welsh onions have a more delicate and subtle taste.
As the old proverb goes, an ordinary teacher tells, a good teacher explains, an excellent teacher inspires, and I strive to be the latter.
words.defineEn: not unusual or different in any way
words.defineVi: không bất thường hoặc khác biệt theo bất kỳ cách nào

examples: This store is famous for its bait and switch tactics.
The famous author made a mint from royalties on his best-selling books.
The Black Forest in Germany is famous for its beautiful scenery and delicious cake.
I saw a famous actress at the shopping mall today.
My sister's famous sweet cherry jam is a family favorite.
words.defineEn: known by a lot of people
words.defineVi: được nhiều người biết đến

examples: She received a missed call from an unknown phone number.
They were driven to an unknown place in the hills.
Aramide gets vulnerable and emotional as she bares her heart to an unknown lover.
I've learned to live for today for tomorrow never comes, taking risks and pursuing my dreams without fearing the unknown.
Its price is unknown.
words.defineEn: not known by many people; not famous
words.defineVi: không được nhiều người biết đến; không nổi tiếng

examples: To take a deep breath.
As I bite into a black cherry, its deep red juice stains my lips, leaving behind a sweet aftertaste.
The experienced lawyer is streets ahead of her young colleagues, with a deep understanding of the law and years of courtroom experience.
He knew deep down inside that she was right.
His deep love of music moved him to take lessons with Dr. Hill.
words.defineEn: having a great distance from the surface to the bottom
words.defineVi: có một khoảng cách lớn từ bề mặt đến đáy

examples: The river became shallower as we moved farther upstream.
The pond is so shallow that you can easily touch the bottom with your feet.
She planted the flower seeds in a shallow hole in the garden.
The dish should be baked in a shallow pan to ensure even cooking.
He has a reputation for being shallow and only caring about superficial things.
words.defineEn: having a short distance from the surface to the bottom
words.defineVi: có một khoảng cách ngắn từ bề mặt đến đáy
